bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to George L. Rives, August 2, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No 3.
Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, August 2nd 1888.
Mr Ezekiel E. Smith To the Department of State.
SUBJECT:
Examination of Jas R. Newby
ABSTRACT OF CONTENTS.
Dr. J. Henry Roberts who was first designated to examine Jas. R. Newby declines to do so, and sstates as his reason that $5 is insufficient. Dr. A. L. Wykham examines him.
No. 3.
Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, August 2nd 1888
Honorable Goerge L. Rives, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to inform you that, as state in my No 2 despatch, Dr. J. Henry Roberts was designated by me to examine Jas R. Newby, the pension claimant. He consented to do so, but subsequently declined, stating as his reason for such declination, that the stipulated fee $5.00 was not sufficient. In consequence of his failure I designated A. L. Wykham, M. D. who proceeded to perform the designed examination, as per inclosure 3.
I have the honor to be, sir, your obedient servant
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul Gen'l
Inclosures 3
1 E. E. SMith to Dr. Wykham 2 Dr Wykham to E. E. Smith 3 Envelop addressed to the commission of pensions- forwarded Sep 4 88
Consulate of the United States, Monrovia, July 31st 1888.

Sir: By instruction of the State Department of the United States Government, I hereby designate you to examine Mer. James R. Newby, an applicant for pension from my government. You will find all necessary information appertaining to said case from the inclosed papers.
Permit me to state that Mer. J. H. Roberts, M. D. (on account of his seniority) was first designated to perofrm the examination, but owing to the smallness of the fee, $5, he declines to do so.
Respectfully, Ezek. E. Smith U.S. Consul Gen'l.
Monrovia La. Aug 1st 1888
Hon. E. E. Smith U.S. Consul Gen.
Sir I have carefully examined James R. Newby and prepared papers concerning his case as you requested.
I am sir your obed Servt
Alfred Leoy Kharp
